title: How a Former Oil Guy Is Using Fracking Tech to Boost Geothermal Energy
description: Fervo's CEO says oil industry technology can unlock new sources of zero-emission geothermal energy.

title: Attacks on Hospitals Mean Health Care is One of the U.S.’s Most Violent Fields
description: The shooting at Legacy Good Samaritan Medical Center in Portland was part of a wave of gun violence sweeping through U.S. hospitals and medical centers

title: William Friedkin, Oscar-Winning Director of The French Connection and The Exorcist, Dies at 87
description: The Oscar winning director known for "The French Connection" and "The Exorcist" died Monday

title: Even Zoom Is Calling Employees Back to the Office
description: Zoom, which helped millions work from home during the pandemic, is requiring employees return to the office.

title: ‘Of Course’ Trump Lost the 2020 Election, DeSantis Says
description: The Florida Governor acknowledged Trump lost in 2020 after years of equivocating answers.

title: Early Puberty Soared During the Pandemic, and Scientists Don’t Know Why
description: Scientists are exploring why the COVID-19 pandemic triggered a wave of precocious puberty in U.S. girls.

title: TIME Launches Inaugural TIME Impact House in Martha’s Vineyard
description: Presented with Founding Partner UBS, the multi-day event series will convene leaders and changemakers to drive social impact (New York, NY—August 7) The first-ever TIME Impact House—a dedicated space to convene and facilitate meaningful action and drive impactful change—debuts today in Martha’s Vineyard.   Presented with Founding Partner UBS, the world’s leading global wealth manager, the…

title: Biden Plans to Run on Protecting Democracy, as Trump Faces Charges of Subverting It
description: White House officials say that Biden wants to avoid weighing in on Trump’s cases, even as the latest charges align with a key argument Biden intends to make to voters in 2024.

title: How the U.S. and Iran Might Reach a Nuclear ‘Understanding’
description: While relations between Washington and Tehran have, if anything, gotten more tense in recent weeks, it’s too soon to declare diplomacy dead.

title: Time Is Running Out For Congress to Protect Election Workers Before 2024
description: Amid predictions of a powder-keg environment at polling places next year, election workers are urging Congress to do more to keep them safe.

title: Where You Live Can Shape How Alzheimer’s Affects You
description: Alzheimer’s is the #5 killer of Americans, but location and demographics play a big role

title: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un Tours Arms Factories, and Takes Aim at West
description: The North Korean leader pledged to speed up efforts to advance his military’s arms and war readiness.

title: In Latest LGBTQ Crackdown, China Bans Rainbow Attire at Pop Concert
description: Fans attending a concert by Taiwanese singer Chang Hui-mei—better known by her stage name A-Mei—say they were prevented from wearing shirts with rainbows on them inside the Cadillac Arena in Beijing.

title: Tens of Thousands of Scouts Came to South Korea. Now They’re Evacuating as a Storm Looms
description: Hundreds of participants had been treated for heat-related ailments since the jamboree started on Wednesday.

title: Taliban Prepare Suicide Bombers in Water Dispute With Iran
description: After two decades fighting the US, Taliban leaders now find themselves sparring with neighbors as the realities of global warming hit home.

title: Pakistan Set to Call Election This Week After Imran Khan Jailed
description: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif is set to dissolve parliament days before his term expires at the end of the week.
